Reviews.Title: Somewhat of a challenge..........
Reviews.Author: Jan Pergande
Reviews.Content: The unit went together ok, it is the interaction between the DVR and the cameras that is challenging. First you have to be careful because to use this item you also need to buy an internal hard-drive. That point to me isn't really communicate all that clearly. Anyway once I got the unit set up and my cameras set-up I ran the included software from the included disk. I kept getting to a certain point and the indication was that my cameras, though recognized, would not connect to the DVR. I made the dreaded call to the support line and after the usual waiting a tech took over my computer and made the proper selections to get the cameras to connect and record on the DVR. I should note that my cameras are D-Link cameras. Without the tech "showing" me how the connection cycle works there is no way I would have figured it out. The instructions and software did not show these techniques. So plan to spend some time with a tech if you buy this unit. Also somewhat annoying is the fact that from time to time the DVR decides to go off line, so you have to restart and reconnect the cameras. So pay attention when the tech is showing you the sequence because you will need it again.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm!
Reviews.Author: Smedz
Reviews.Content: I bought this item the first week of Dec 2012. It was easy to set up and it currently supports 4 IP cameras and I'm getting ready to add two more. I have had no trouble with it and I can access it remotely just as advertised. I would highly recommend the DNR-322L for home or small business network camera security sytem.

Reviews.Title: Terrible. Worse than Terrible.
Reviews.Author: Arlo Miller
Reviews.Content: The interface for this thing looks straightforward enough, but I assure you this thing is pretty near impossible to get working.I'm trying to use it with two DLink cameras.  It can connect to them and I can get a live view, but cannot record.  I've restored the device to defaults and started over, following the install guides from the beginning, line by line. Still nothing. I can get it on the network, it will connect to the cameras. I can set up the recording schedules.  But this network recorder refuses to record.  So, its pretty much useless.  I've gone through the setup a half dozen times now.
